title: Typeface question... any help is appreciated!!
content:
I am doing a project for my process and skills class and I am having trouble trying to figure out the exact typeface for this logo. If anyone can please let me know it would be greatly appreciated!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Logo\_TM\_LockUp\_RED.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/typophile.com/files/Logo_TM_LockUp_RED.jpg) | 359.1 KB |

 [‹ Modern Serif?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/typophile.com/node/52405 "Go to previous forum topic") [Cryptic Clothing logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/typophile.com/node/52182 "Go to next forum topic")
author: samanthavacca

comments.content: Very similar to [Brauer Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Brauer+Neue/) and [Helvetica Rounded Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/helvetica_std_rounded_bold_condensed/) but it is neither. It’s also possible that this is a modified [Helvetica Inserat](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/helvetica_std_inserat_roman/)

I thought [Block Gothic Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214646/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/block-gothic-rr/) was the closest I could find. The Condensed bold weight might have been squeezed, or the Extra Condensed width might have been widened.

- Mike Yanega
